intro: Nephelea incana, commonly known as the silverleaf nephelea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Nephelea incana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
